newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka to sell stake in Lanka Ceramic.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka to sell stake in Lanka Ceramic.

text.p: Sri Lanka's Public Enterprise Reform Commission (PERC) on Friday called for proposals to sell the government's holding in Lanka Ceramic Ltd.
PERC, the state body which oversees privatisations, asked brokers for proposals by May 23 to sell 5.1 million shares or 17.3 percent of Lanka Ceramic's issued capital of 30 million shares.
Lanka Ceramic was privatised in mid-1993 by selling 15 percent to Japan's Noritake and 25 percent to the public. Employees own 10 percent, and the balance is held by unlisted Uniwalkers group.
At 0630 GMT, the scrip was trading at 39 rupees, up from 38.50 at Thursday's close.
Stock market analysts welcomed the news, saying the move would improve investor interest in Colombo.
"The government has substantial holdings in over a dozen listed companies, and this could be the first step towards shedding all that," said an analyst who declined to be identified.
"Share liquidity will improve and the government will also be able to get a good price since Colombo is on a roll right now," he added.
Colombo stocks have risen over 20 percent this year due to good growth expectations, low interest rates and the government and opposition agreeing to work together to end the ethnic conflict.
